summary: This document is an email chain from June 2021 forwarding a letter received from an inmate at Greene Correctional Facility. The letter references Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein but reportedly contains no references to NXIVM victims or defendants. The FBI's C-20 Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force is the intended recipient.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referenced in an inmate letter that was forwarded to the FBI's C-20 task force. The document confirms the letter mentions her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced in an inmate letter that was forwarded to the FBI's C-20 task force. The document confirms the letter mentions him.

connections.description: Both are referenced together in an inmate letter that was forwarded to law enforcement, indicating their association is a subject of interest.

events.title: Inmate Letter Received
events.description: An investigator in Saratoga, NY receives an email and a letter from an inmate at Greene Correctional Facility. The letter references Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Email Forwarded to FBI C-20
events.description: An email chain is forwarded to the FBI's C-20 Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force regarding the inmate letter mentioning Maxwell and Epstein.

keyFacts: An inmate at Greene Correctional Facility sent a letter referencing Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.
The letter was reviewed and found to contain no references to NXIVM victims or defendants, despite the initial subject line.
The correspondence was forwarded to the FBI's C-20 Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force for potential follow-up.
The document shows ongoing law enforcement interest in information related to Maxwell and Epstein in 2021.
The document is subject to a protective order restricting certain paragraphs.
